intro: Linanthus pungens subsp. hallii, commonly known as the Hall's linanthus, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, hairy stems and showy, yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. Linanthus pungens subsp. hallii is often found in desert scrub and is of interest to botanists due to its ecological and evolutionary significance.
